text: Fenton Reuben McCreery (April 21, 1866 Flint, Michigan–October 6, 1940) Index to Politicians: Mccornack to Mccullis -- Fenton Reuben McCreery entry was the American Minister Resident/Consul General to the Dominican Republic (1907 until 1909) and Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary to Honduras (1909 until 1911). He was also Chargé d'affaires in Chile from 1892 until 1893. McCreery was the son of William B. McCreery and Ada Birdsall Fenton. He attended the Michigan Military Academy and graduated the University of Michigan in 1888. he is buried at Glenwood Cemetery (Flint, Michigan). ==References== Category:1866 births Category:1940 deaths Category:People from Flint, Michigan Category:American consuls Category:Burials at Glenwood Cemetery (Flint, Michigan) Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Chile Category:Ambassadors of the United States to the Dominican Republic Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Honduras Category:University of Michigan alumni Category:19th-century American diplomats Category:20th-century American diplomats
title: Fenton R. McCreery
